content.body: Hey smaug, do you think you could take a look at https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1261 soon?
content.formatted_body: Hey smaug, do you think you could take a look at https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1261 soon?

content.body: Let me try, hmm, later today
Dominic Farolino: have you started to try to figure out range/selection handling?
content.formatted_body: Dominic Farolino: have you started to try to figure out range/selection handling?

content.body: shadow dom selection itself is still unclear even without any moves
session history might have some interesting stuff too, if iframes move
smaug: You're asking specifically about https://github.com/whatwg/dom/issues/1255 right? (Because I think #1261 is very much a subset of that work, unrelated to all the tricky stuff over in #1255.)
content.formatted_body: smaug: You're asking specifically about https://github.com/whatwg/dom/issues/1255 right? (Because I think #1261 is very much a subset of that work, unrelated to all the tricky stuff over in #1255.)

content.body: right, I'm asking about that, since I assume 1261 is done because of that
Eh, the two are related but how dependent they are is unclear. #1261 needs to get done regardless, though it probably helps out with #1255 to some limited extent, yeah.
We have not dug into all of the nastiness of selection/range of #1255 yet, though that is next on my agenda :)
Dominic Farolino: ok, so this is more about just defining things better in the spec.
content.formatted_body: Dominic Farolino: ok, so this is more about just defining things better in the spec.

content.body: I wasn't quite sure about the context here
Pretty much yeah. Like I said, I think it will help out with the iframe atomic move case in general, which is nice, but it also stands on its own outside of that work
